Man City player ratings vs Tottenham: Get Gianluigi Donnarumma's agent on the phone! Jittery James Trafford's glaring error hurts hosts as Erling Haaland fluffs his lines
Source: Goal.com    Published: 2025-08-23 13:39:35

The goalkeeper had a nightmare display in goal and the Norwegian striker was blunt as Pep Guardiola's side were stunned by a ruthlessly-effective Spurs James Trafford must have dreamt for many years of making his debut at the Etihad Stadium after growing up at the club but when it finally came it was the stuff of nightmares. The goalkeeper made two big mistakes and cost his side a 2-0 defeat at home to Tottenham, completely deflating all the optimism after their crushing opening-day bashing of Wolves. City made a dominant start, with Omar Marmoush taking the initiative with some very bright play down the left wing. He poked wide of the far post and forced three saves from Guglielmo Vicario but Spurs struck first through a clever break beginning in their area. The move saw Richarlison chase a knock-down and play the perfect cut-back for Brennan Johnson to hit home first time and although the goal was initially flagged offside, it was then awarded by VAR and, from there, Tottenham continued to unsettle their hosts on the break, and especially Trafford. The goalkeeper arrived late to a challenge with Mohammed Kudus but escaped without giving away a foul or, thankfully for him, a red card. But things got far worse from the unlikely scenario of a City goal-kick, which they decided to play short. Trafford took a pass from Dias and tried to play in Nico Gonzalez but he was robbed by Pape Matar Sarr and it led to a scramble in the area, allowing Joao Palhinha to slam the loose ball in. City barely knew what hit them and Spurs dominated most of the second half. Pep Guardiola was so desperate he put on Rodri despite warning of the dangers of bringing him back too soon. It made little difference as Bernardo Silva's shot off the bar was the closest they came to finding a way back. GOAL rates Man City's players from the Etihad Stadium...

Gio Reyna set for Borussia Monchengladbach medical ahead of Borussia Dortmund transfer
Source: The New York Times    Published: 2025-08-23 10:44:45

No Problem Importance of Height at Set Pieces Tennis Home U.S. Open Mixed Doubles Golf Home Peak College Sports Global Sports Soccer Women's Soccer Home Women's Euros Bracket NWSL Schedule Full Time Newsletter Podcasts Women's Euros Women's World Cup NWSL USWNT College Sports MLS Home Teams Scores & Schedule Standings Podcasts NWSL Home Scores & Schedule Standings Full Time newsletter Podcasts Formula 1 Home Prime Tire newsletter Schedule Standings McLaren Ferrari Red Bull Mercedes Aston Martin Alpine Haas Racing Bulls Williams Sauber Olympics Home Sports Business Home MoneyCall Newsletter Opinion Home Betting Home Odds Fantasy Baseball NFL Picks UK Betting Fantasy Baseball Home MLB Home Podcasts Betting Starting Pitcher Rankings Terminology Memorabilia and Collectibles Culture Home Motorsports Home Podcasts NASCAR Women's Hockey Home MMA Home Boxing Home Moses Itauma vs. Dillian Whyte The Pulse Newsletter Cities Iowa State vs. Kansas State Arsenal vs. Leeds NFL Preseason Today's News Connections: Sports Edition Bundesliga Summer Transfer Window Gio Reyna has completed his move from Borussia Dortmund to Borussia Monchengladbach. The Athletic reported on Friday that Gladbach had agreed a deal in principle to sign the USMNT international and he underwent a medical ahead of the transfer on Saturday. With Reyna's Dortmund contract set to expire next summer, the club felt a long-term extension to his deal would not make sense for either party. Midfielder Gio Reyna has completed a move to league rivals Borussia Mönchengladbach with immediate effect. Wishing you the best in your next chapter, Gio! 🇺🇸💛 pic.twitter.com/j7eMoTqHk3 — Borussia Dortmund (@BlackYellow) August 23, 2025 Reyna, 22, was open to the move in his search for regular football ahead of the 2026 World Cup, which the United States will co-host. The move to Gladbach sees him link up with international team-mate and close friend Joe Scally, with whom he came through the NYCFC ranks. Clubs in Spain and Portugal previously looked at the attacking midfielder, while Parma in Italy had also previously expressed an interest. Reyna joined Dortmund aged 16 in July 2019. He became the youngest player to make 50 Bundesliga appearances aged 18 years and 14 days, a record that has since been broken by Florian Wirtz, but his game time has been limited in recent seasons. Reyna has only started 14 Bundesliga games since the beginning of the 2021-22 season, and made 26 appearances last season with just five of those as a starter. He spent the second half of the 2023-24 campaign on loan at Nottingham Forest. Reyna was sidelined for two and a half months last season, missing 19 games for club and country, after picking up a groin issue in early September 2024. Advertisement He was not included in Mauricio Pochettino's Gold Cup squad this summer as Dortmund wanted him to be a part of the Club World Cup squad. He made just one substitute appearance in the 1-0 group-stage win over Ulsan HD as the German club reached the quarter-finals. Capped 32 times since receiving his first USMNT call-up in November 2020, Reyna has featured 147 times for Dortmund, scoring 19 goals and providing 18 assists. The end for Reyna at Dortmund has been coming for a while. It's been several years since he was a consistent member of the first team: he started three Bundesliga games last season and just one the year before. The need for a career reset is self-evident and perhaps Gladbach, who remain a big club, albeit one some way down from its historic peaks in the 1970s, can be an ideal venue to rediscover some momentum. Talent was not the problem in Dortmund. Instead, it was availability, and Reyna's struggle to avoid the small muscular issues that have so often derailed his progress and prevented him from establishing a rhythm at the Westfalenstadion. Ultimately, that is why the club have allowed his contract to run down and now, with a year left until its end, are happy to allow him to leave. Can Reyna regain his status in the game? Within his camp, there's hope that the right club and the faith of the right coach could elevate him back in the European perception. For now, though, the aim is simpler: he must find somewhere to play consistently. At just 22, there's plenty of time yet. (Photo: Michael Reaves/Getty Images) Spot the pattern. How the Trump-Infantino bromance resurfaced to shatter Vegas' World Cup draw hopes
Source: The New York Times    Published: 2025-08-23 08:53:22
